steps.title: Exercise.
steps.content: Exercise. Holding the plank position is hard. Consider doing the plank exercise first, until you can easily hold your body rigid long enough to take a good picture.

steps.title: Get friends to plank with.
steps.content: Get friends to plank with. You can’t plank by yourself. At the very least, you need someone to take your picture! The more friends you plank with, the more fun it will be. Get a group together or find a local group.

steps.title: Get a camera.
steps.content: Get a camera. If you plank in a park and no one is around to see it, did you plank? Pics or it didn’t happen.

steps.title: Search other images to get inspiration.
steps.content: Search other images to get inspiration. You can look around the Internet by searching plank tags or using Google to get ideas of clever or funny places to plank. This can also help you build an idea of what makes a good plank pic and location.

steps.title: Keep your eye out.
steps.content: Keep your eye out. Look for potential places to plank as you go around your town or visit other places. Look for any place that might be funny or unique.

steps.title: Be random.
steps.content: Be random. You can also just try being random. Pick a random location, such as a local park, and simply go there and plank on whatever you can. Improvising like this can lead to more unique pictures.

steps.title: Avoid getting in trouble.
steps.content: Avoid getting in trouble. As you are preparing to plank, be sure you won’t get in trouble. Do it in a location where you won’t bother anyone or break anything, or do it in a less acceptable location when no one is watching. You don’t want to get in a fight with a cop over planking. That’s not going to sound very impressive later on when you have to tell the story every time you apply for a job.

steps.title: Get in position.
steps.content: Get in position. Lay face-down in a rigid, straight position. Balance on whatever object or surface you wish to plank on. Hold your arms at your side, palm flat against your thigh. Keep your feet perpendicular with the line of your legs, if possible, so that your toes touch the planking surface.

steps.title: Take the picture.
steps.content: Take the picture. Get whatever friend you brought with you to take the picture. Be sure that the camera is adjusted for lighting if taking the picture at night or in a dark location. Upload the picture for all the internet to marvel at.
